com.nhaarman.listviewanimations.itemmanipulation.dragdrop

Class HoverDrawable

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.graphics.drawable.Drawable
      • android.graphics.drawable.BitmapDrawable
        • com.nhaarman.listviewanimations.itemmanipulation.dragdrop.HoverDrawable

  •  class HoverDrawable
extends BitmapDrawable
    A Drawable which represents a dragging View.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class android.graphics.drawable.Drawable

        Drawable.Callback, Drawable.ConstantState

      Creates a new HoverDrawable for given View, using given MotionEvent.

    • Constructor Detail

      • HoverDrawable

        HoverDrawable(View view,
             MotionEvent ev)
        Creates a new HoverDrawable for given View, using given MotionEvent.
        Parameters:
        view - the View to represent.
        ev - the MotionEvent to use as down position.

      • HoverDrawable

        HoverDrawable(View view,
             float downY)
        Creates a new HoverDrawable for given View, using given MotionEvent.
        Parameters:
        view - the View to represent.
        downY - the y coordinate of the down event.

    • Method Detail

      • handleMoveEvent

        void handleMoveEvent(MotionEvent ev)
        Calculates the new position for this HoverDrawable using given MotionEvent.
        Parameters:
        ev - the MotionEvent. ev.getActionMasked() should typically equal MotionEvent.ACTION_MOVE.

      • onScroll

        void onScroll(float mobileViewTopY)
        Updates the original y position of the view, and calculates the scroll distance.
        Parameters:
        mobileViewTopY - the top y coordinate of the mobile view this HoverDrawable represents.

      • isMovingUpwards

        boolean isMovingUpwards()
        Returns whether the user is currently dragging this HoverDrawable upwards.
        Returns:
        true if dragging upwards.

      • getDeltaY

        int getDeltaY()
        Returns the number of pixels between the original y coordinate of the view, and the current y coordinate. A negative value means this HoverDrawable is moving upwards.
        Returns:
        the number of pixels.

      • getTop

        int getTop()
        Returns the top coordinate of this HoverDrawable.

      • setTop

        void setTop(int top)
        Sets the top coordinate of this HoverDrawable.

      • shift

        void shift(int height)
        Shifts the original y coordinates of this HoverDrawable {code height} pixels upwards or downwards, depending on the move direction.
        Parameters:
        height - the number of pixels this HoverDrawable should be moved. Should be positive.
